intro: Pavetta tonkinensis var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth pavetta, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture, contributing to its common name. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
